answers.q: what charger to use for acer e e573
answers.a: E573 refers to aluminium stearate, a food additive; the charger question relates to an Acer laptop model and is unrelated to this additive.

answers.q: what does aluminum stearate do in injection
answers.a: In pharmaceutical oil-based injections, aluminum stearate acts as a gelling/suspending agent to increase viscosity and enable depot (slow‑release) formulations; it isn’t used for aqueous injections.

answers.q: what is a metal soap aluminum stearate
answers.a: It’s the aluminum salt of stearic acid (a “metal soap”), a hydrophobic powder used as an emulsifier, thickener, and anti‑caking agent in foods and other products.

answers.q: what is magnesium stearate and aluminum
answers.a: Magnesium stearate (E470b) and aluminum stearate (E573) are both metal soaps of stearic acid; magnesium stearate is mainly a lubricant/flow agent, while aluminum stearate is used more as an emulsifier, thickener, and anti‑caking agent.
